title: "Face blindness may arise from deficits beyond visual perception"
excerpt: "The ability to recognize faces is a complex neurocognitive skill with important social implications. The disorder, which, according to some estimates, affects more than 2 percent of the population, can lead to isolation and anxiety and impair personal and work relationships."
